entry.title: Make the event type check for d&d more explicit
entry.content:
A user may release a mouse button that is not a part of d&d operation,

and it can still cancel the drag and drop. Instead, explicitly check

the left button (or other buttons), to decide if the drag and drop

should be canceled.



A few extra changes

* Moved ShellClientData from shell_unittest.cc for reuse

* Added wl_pointer support to TestClient

* changed set_data so that it returns the pointer of moved object.

I added DestroyData as template can't take nullptr any more.

* Added generic button support to EventGenerator



Bug: 1513068

Test: covered by unittest

Low-Coverage-Reason: 　TRIVIAL_CHANGE logging code.

entry.content:
Events that have been recorded lose much of the information that is

human readable. To simplify the implementation, events that are recorded

while the page is open and events that are loaded use the same

interface. The webpage is notified of new events once they have been

fully processed instead of before.

entry.title: Add OTR parameter to ClipboardHostImpl::CreateDataEndpoint
entry.content:
CrOS DLP relies on the destination endpoint by null for OTR browser

context (see crrev.com/c/3026850). However, Data Controls still needs

the endpoint generated by ClipboardHostImpl::CreateDataEndpoint as it

can apply its rules to OTR browser contexts.



This CL adds an `include_otr` parameter to override the behavior for the

code path to be used by Data Controls, while leaving other CrOS DLP

behavior intact.

entry.title: Reset password of gaia user when the device is cloned using SysPrep.
entry.content:
On GCPW installation, a dummy Windows account called "gaia" is

created.

This "gaia" user has a password randomly generated. This password is

stored in Windows LSA store. However if the device where GCPW was

installed is cloned to another machine via SysPrep, changing the

password of "gaia" user on the target machine will reduce the

security threats for GCPW.



Bug: 1512902

entry.title: [omnibox][ml] Search blending & don't force keywords to be default.
entry.content:
`kForceAllowedToBeDefault` attempted to allow all matches to be

inlineable. In the short term, this is for fishfooding. Though long

term, we might consider experimenting with removing/adjusting the

multiple ranking adjustments.



Ranking today is determined not only by scores (traditional or ML), but

also other constraints like:

- allowed to be default

- preserving the default match

- search grouping

- boosting

- transferred matches



We've tuned over the years the final ranking to look good. But it's

likley ranking without these contraints would expose some problematic

cases. I.e. these constraints act like crutches. E.g., if HQP matches

are generally scored too high, it won't affect metrics and our

perception much because the allowed to be default constraint will

prevent them from being defaulted anyways.



Likewise, this makes it hard to evaluate ML ranking. Inputs for which ML

does worse (or better) than traditional ranking can go unnoticed if the

additional constraints are making the shown ranking deviate from the

pure score ranking. This also constrain the ML model's potential, even

if we have a perfect ML model, if the matches can't be shown in their

optimal order.



All that background aside, this CL is pretty small:



1) Excludes keyword matches from `kForceAllowedToBeDefault`. Otherwise,

inputs like 'github.com' would do a google search for

'ithub.com' because 'g' would enter keyword mode.



2) Adds a param to ignore the search v URL balance we currently try to

maintain. When enabled, we simply linearly scale the ML scores from

[0, 1] to, e.g., [600, 2800] and let normal ranking and culling

decide how many searches should be shown, whether the default should

be a search or URL, etc. Shortcut boosting is also no longer kept

constant; URLs are grouped above searches if they score above a

certain threshold. We can tune the scaling so that the overall search

balance is maintained and metrics don't regress. Like above,

hopefully, this will make good/bad ML cases easier to spot.



3. Re-adds `RecordAdditionalInfo()` for "ml legacy relevance" & "ml

model output" which were accidentally removed in one of the recent

refactor CLs.



Bug: 1405555

Change-Id: I7f7a200524a257649c6d3e7afebf3b7633138344

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5185583

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

Commit-Queue: manuk hovanesian

Reviewed-by: Angela Yoeurng

entry.title: Extensions: Features: Add an example to make it easier for quick usage
entry.content:
This was inspired by a recent question asking how to use an extension

features. Detailed examples already exist in base/feature_list.h, but

the indirection required to find it means that it would be more useful

if a short example was brought to the header file where each extension

feature is declared. That way, anyone using the feature can glance at

the top of the file to get started, saving time and removing confusion.



https://crsrc.org/base/feature_list.h;l=175-179;drc=b000a8caec2747d71b045b2c44e12c9cf8b11c75

entry.title: Shared Storage: Allow file schemes in database
entry.content:
Currently we don't allow the 'file://' origin to use the shared

storage database. For some perf tests that we intend to

add shortly, however, it will be easier if we can load our

HTML files locally.



Also, at the moment, it is possible to crash the browser by either

navigating to a file origin and opening the Shared Storage page viewer

in DevTools for 'file://'. Similarly, if a user tries to load a local

file that uses shared storage, then the browser crashes.



We fix this by removing the relevant DCHECKs in

`SharedStorageDatabase`.



Bug: 1516507,1218540

entry.title: Pass color provider to CSSParser::ParseSystemColor
entry.content:
This CL is a follow up on CL:5085762. In this CL, we plumb color

providers that exist in Blink::Page to the CSSParser::ParseSystemColor.



The CL starts by adding an extra ColorProvider argument to the

ParseSystemColor method and updates all of its call sites.

In order to get the color provider from the Page via the document,

we introduce a GetColorProvider method in BaseRenderingContext2D

class that returns a color provider from the document.



This CL does not use the color providers to get the system colors yet.

The next steps would involve updating StyleColor::ColorFromKeyword to

take in a color provider, using the passed color provider in

LayoutTheme::SystemColor and remove the SystemColorFromNativeTheme

method from LayoutTheme.

entry.title: Revert "Make legacy colors store [0,255] internally"
entry.content:
This reverts commit b98dc5706a670bb7b2ba8b25a6e0e787e58d5aec.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5766743815356416



Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8758728881458395009

Affected test(s):

[ninja://:blink_web_tests/fast/gradients/unprefixed-radial-gradients-color-hints.html](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2F:blink_web_tests%2Ffast%2Fgradients%2Funprefixed-radial-gradients-color-hints.html?q=VHash%3A1da32bc6d12138b3)



If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F5766743815356416&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5184777&type=BUG



Original change's description:

> Make legacy colors store [0,255] internally

>

> See discussion here: https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/9759

> This CL fixes WPTs that are being were added here:

> https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/43931/files

>

> We were previously normalizing legacy srgb colors so that they could

> be treated interchangeably with non-legacy srgb colors. Unfortunately

> this breaks math for relative colors, for example:

>

> rgb(from red calc(r - 127) g b)

>

> Should result in a half red, not black.

>

> The clearest way to fix this is simply to store legacy srgb colors in

> the [0,255] range, so that we're not faking it on serialization

> either. This of course makes conversions more complex as we have to

> tread SRGBLegacy and SRGB as different color spaces, though they are

> converted between one another by a simple multiplication or division

> by 255.

>

> Also in this CL:

> - Renamed ClampInt to ClampInt255, since that's what it does.

> - Added a SerializeInternal() function to blink::Color that both CSS,

> Legacy and Canvas serializers all use. It's useful for debugging since

> it does not do things like converting hsl/hwb to srgb.

> - Removed color-valid-relative-color.html from failure expectations,

> so now we have an expectations file.

>

> The six new failures in color-computed-relative-color are due to bad

> tests that assume this mapping specifically does not happen.

>

> Of the 42 failures in color-valid-relative-color, 36 are old and were

> being suppressed by testExpectations. The 6 new ones are the same as

> for the computed file.

>

> Bug: 1517349

> Change-Id: I5e4bb8a4d469e0d018ce5022accdb6bc22b4c4dc

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5184777

private method was mostly making the checks related to the context.

entry.title: Revert "[ios] Track duration of the password save/update infobar"
entry.content:
This reverts commit f82042dd87f27e5ecf7f4a26f089ac862196918d.



Reason for revert: Failing https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/ipad-device/41809/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> [ios] Track duration of the password save/update infobar

>

> This CL adds the PasswordManager.iOS.InfoBar.{Type}Duration.{Moment}

> metric which is summarized as follow:

> """

> Records the duration of the password save/update infobar that is

> presented after using new credentials. Recorded when the

> password infobar banner is dismissed.

>

> Token key "Type":

> - variant "Save": the save infobar

> - variant "Update": the update infobar

>

> Token key "Moment":

> - variant "All": all moments

> - variant "OnDeletion": when deleting the infobar

> - variant "OnDismiss: when dismissing the infobar

> """

>

> This CL has also other effects:

> * Record metrics as soon as the infobar is dismissed instead of

> waiting until deletion. This should be no op as the infobar can

> only be presented once during the lifetime of the delegate, hence

> there shouldn't be a difference in the metrics when recording right

> after dismissal VS on delegate deletion. This has the advantage of

> speeding up the recording of infobar metrics on dismiss.

>

> Change-Id: If056bd6b5d28e1cc88b0809019ff5d3e1560dba7

> Bug: b/318687052, b/317337446, 1394793

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5172194

> Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

> Reviewed-by: Mohamed Amir Yosef

> Reviewed-by: Tommy Martino

> Commit-Queue: Vincent Boisselle

> Reviewed-by: Sylvain Defresne

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1247568}

entry.title: Apply clang-format directly to avoid bugs in git cl format
entry.content:
In https://crrev.com/c/5190439, `git cl format` is not able to correctly

format the files in the CL. The workaround is to run `clang-format`

directly over the entire file. However, this introduces too much noise

into that CL.



This CL is _purely_ generated by running `clang-format $f -i` for each

affected file `$f`, thereby applying any formatting rules that have been

introduced but not universally applied -- mostly braces around

1-statement blocks. It has no functional impact.



Change-Id: If69ac22d41eaadcb72a4dae999c3e25774152e1e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5201468

Reviewed-by: Matt Menke

Commit-Queue: Dustin Mitchell

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1247654}

entry.title: [mullet m2] Fix having no label when triggering field is Address Line 1
entry.content:
When the triggering field contains Address Line 1, the code also

considered Address Line 1 as a label candidate, which ended up actually

adding it as a label. Our logic prevents having the same label as the

main text, so the label was completely removed.



Even if the profile had a country, the country is only added as a label

as a last resort. The new test has two profiles which only differ by

country. This test prevents this issue.





Bug: 1459990

entry.title: Remove ContentLayerClient::PaintableRegion()
entry.content:
Reasons:

1. All implementations of ContentLayerClient just returned

gfx::Rect(layer_bounds).

2. cc::RecordSource and cc::RasterSource can get the total bounds

of visual rects of paint operations from cc::DisplayItemList

cheaply, without needing the client to tell cc with the function.



This CL doesn't change any visible behavior.



In the next steps for crbug.com/1517714, we will use

DisplayItemList::bounds() which is added in this CL returning

the total bounds of the painted results to determine the tiling

area to avoid unnecessary tiles in areas that are just for

hit-testing.



Bug: 1517714

entry.title: Add support for async os_crypt in //chrome.
entry.content:
This CL sets a cookie_encryption_provider on profile network

context params, when enabled by the feature

"UseOsCryptAsyncForCookieEncryption". The cookie encryption

provider implementation is held by the SystemNetworkContextManager.



This feature and associated code is built on Windows only, for

now, but the intention is to expand this to other platforms

in a future CL.



When this configuration is enabled, cookie encryption is

delegated to the async version of OSCrypt.



Since OSCrypt is not yet populated with any providers, the

Encryptor instance returned from OSCrypt Async is empty, so

this will simply end up calling the same code, in the same process,

thus no behavior change is expected from this CL.



Tests are added to verify that the data is compatible between

sync and async, in both directions, which is to be expected

as the same code is being called in the network service.



Bug: 1373092

Change-Id: If9e7f3fc70b9b067cd72084a526b22cb6a9e5da1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5109566

entry.title: Add optional debug tracking for which raw_ptrs reference a chunk of memory.
entry.content:
This should make it easier to debug dangling errors like:

A freed allocation is still referenced by a dangling pointer at exit, or

at test end. Leaked raw_ptr/raw_ref could cause PartitionAlloc's

quarantine memory bloat.



Another potential use of the instance tracer is to report dangling ptrs

as soon as they are detected, rather than when a dangling raw_ptr

instance is destroyed; that potential use is not explored in this CL.



The implementation strategy:

- since raw_ptr is marked as TRIVIAL_ABI, pointer identity of the

raw_ptr itself cannot be used for this tracking. Instead, when the

instance tracer is enabled, each raw_ptr embeds a 64-bit ID, which is

simply a monotonically-increasing sequence number.

- when a raw_ptr wraps a non-null pointer, an entry is inserted into a

global table associating the raw_ptr's ID with the allocation and the

current stack trace.

- similarly, when a raw_ptr releases "ownership" of a non-null pointer,

the corresponding entry is removed from the global table.

- if dangling references are detected, scan the global table for any

matching slots indicating live references.



The runtime penalty for this is <10%.



Change-Id: I5d52b6266d3e685bf0a7600f7c1e986a69cdeaf6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4869878

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

entry.title: [base] Prevent post-shutdown check from CONTINUE_ON_SHUTDOWN scope.
entry.content:
A CONTINUE_ON_SHUTDOWN task may still be running after the ThreadPool

has been shutdown. A race where it posts back to a BLOCK_SHUTDOWN

sequence is a coincidence and cannot be considered part of a series of

shutdown blocking work, it is therefore okay to fizzle the check in

that case.



New PostAfterShutdownFromContinueOnShutdown test fails, as desired,

without accompanying task_tracker.cc change.



R=etiennep@chromium.org



Bug: 1499644

entry.title: Reset folder contents container transform in ResetState
entry.content:
AppListFolderView::ResetState resets the folder view state, including

resetting any pending folder animations. This prevents individual

animation's implicit animation observers from running, so the state set

by running animations needs to be reset after resetting animation

instances - ContentsContainerAnimation updates the folder view contents

container transform, so the contents container view transform needs to

be cleared.



BUG=b/303688367

entry.title: [ios] Track duration of the password save/update infobar
entry.content:
This CL adds the PasswordManager.iOS.InfoBar.{Type}Duration.{Moment}

metric which is summarized as follow:

"""

Records the duration of the password save/update infobar that is

presented after using new credentials. Recorded when the

password infobar banner is dismissed.



Token key "Type":

- variant "Save": the save infobar

- variant "Update": the update infobar



Token key "Moment":

- variant "All": all moments

- variant "OnDeletion": when deleting the infobar

- variant "OnDismiss: when dismissing the infobar

"""



This CL has also other effects:

* Record metrics as soon as the infobar is dismissed instead of

waiting until deletion. This should be no op as the infobar can

only be presented once during the lifetime of the delegate, hence

there shouldn't be a difference in the metrics when recording right

after dismissal VS on delegate deletion. This has the advantage of

speeding up the recording of infobar metrics on dismiss.



Change-Id: If056bd6b5d28e1cc88b0809019ff5d3e1560dba7

entry.title: Reduce the range of GestureTime metric
entry.content:
The metric records how long it takes to perform a stylus gesture. However, because of the size of the buckets, the majority (70%) of data was being recorded in the 0-10ms bucket which wasn't helpful. This change should create more buckets between 0 and 10ms which should more accurately show the average time for gestures.

entry.title: Fix VariationsService et al being recreated on shutdown.
entry.content:
If shutdown has started and MetricsServicesManager and the

objects it owns (including VariationsService) have been

destroyed already, return nullptr from their getters, instead

of recreating them.



Note: Call sites are already expected to check for null and

the one known call site that was calling us on shutdown does

already. If any other call site does this but doesn't check

for null, we'll notice it as a result of a null pointer deref

crash and can fix it as a follow-up.



The iOS code is also updated to have this defensive logic,

even if this issue was not observed on iOS so far.



Bug: 1517706

entry.title: Make legacy colors store [0,255] internally
entry.content:
See discussion here: https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/9759

This CL fixes WPTs that are being were added here:

https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/43931/files



We were previously normalizing legacy srgb colors so that they could

be treated interchangeably with non-legacy srgb colors. Unfortunately

this breaks math for relative colors, for example:



rgb(from red calc(r - 127) g b)



Should result in a half red, not black.



The clearest way to fix this is simply to store legacy srgb colors in

the [0,255] range, so that we're not faking it on serialization

either. This of course makes conversions more complex as we have to

tread SRGBLegacy and SRGB as different color spaces, though they are

converted between one another by a simple multiplication or division

by 255.



Also in this CL:

- Renamed ClampInt to ClampInt255, since that's what it does.

- Added a SerializeInternal() function to blink::Color that both CSS,

Legacy and Canvas serializers all use. It's useful for debugging since

it does not do things like converting hsl/hwb to srgb.

- Removed color-valid-relative-color.html from failure expectations,

so now we have an expectations file.



The six new failures in color-computed-relative-color are due to bad

tests that assume this mapping specifically does not happen.



Of the 42 failures in color-valid-relative-color, 36 are old and were

being suppressed by testExpectations. The 6 new ones are the same as

for the computed file.



Bug: 1517349

Change-Id: I5e4bb8a4d469e0d018ce5022accdb6bc22b4c4dc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5184777

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

Reviewed-by: Rune Lillesveen

Commit-Queue: Aaron Krajeski

entry.title: Prerender: Migrate BroadcastChannel to PrerenderChannel (unload event)
entry.content:
This is the second attempt that follows the first one,

crrev.com/c/3520462.



Now the BroadcastChannel is not available while prerendering, and as a

result, these outdated tests have caused timeout.



This patch restores the reverted migration changes as it can resolve

the timeout issue at least. Still tests generate curious text diffs,

but they are still useful to verify coming changes.



In addition to replacement of BroadcastChannel, this CL modifies

message sequences to handle reordering of posted messages.

BroadcastChannel keeps the order of the posted messages, but

PrerenderChannel cannot keep it as PrerenderChannel internally calls

fetch() per message that could be reordered by resource scheduler etc.

To avoid it, this CL combines several messages into a single message.



Bug: 1302831, 1289245

Change-Id: I9d023d7e5e07e9549ed1114ed2d9b8e750a775c6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5198230

Reviewed-by: Hiroki Nakagawa
